heroIntro:
Welcome to your peaceful retirement haven in Rojales, Costa Blanca. This exceptional 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow offers the relaxed lifestyle you've been dreaming of, with premium specification at just €261,900—40% less than equivalent properties on Spanish island markets. Rojales has become a haven for retirees and expats seeking authentic Spanish living combined with modern comforts and year-round Mediterranean sunshine.

Located in this charming pueblo, the property sits within an established expat community where English is widely spoken and friendships flourish naturally. You'll enjoy direct access to healthcare facilities with English-speaking doctors, excellent shopping at local markets, and stunning Blue Flag beaches just 20 minutes away. The 76m² thoughtfully designed space provides everything needed for comfortable, low-maintenance living without the premium prices of coastal resort areas.

With a market trending upward at 8% year-on-year and strong rental potential (€800 weekly typical income), this bungalow represents both a lifestyle choice and a sound financial decision. Whether you're ready to embrace full-time retirement or seeking a secure investment property with earning potential, this home delivers exceptional value in one of Spain's most welcoming communities.
areaSection:
Rojales is a authentic Spanish pueblo located in southern Alicante, just inland from the Costa Blanca coast. This charming municipality sits in the heart of the Vega Baja region, characterized by stunning orange groves, traditional Spanish architecture, and a thriving international community. The climate here is Mediterranean perfection—over 300 days of sunshine annually with mild winters and warm summers, ideal for those leaving harsher northern climates.

The town has successfully blended traditional Spanish character with modern amenities, making it increasingly popular with retirees and property investors. Unlike overtouristed coastal resorts, Rojales maintains authentic village charm while offering all contemporary conveniences. Local weekly markets burst with fresh produce, family-run restaurants serve traditional cuisine, and the cost of living remains remarkably reasonable. The established infrastructure supports both Spanish residents and international newcomers seamlessly.
lifestyleSection:
Daily life in Rojales revolves around a relaxed, authentic pace that retirement demands. Mornings often begin at the local mercado (market), where vendors greet you by name and seasonal Spanish produce fills your shopping basket at fraction of northern European prices. The established expat community ensures you're never isolated—countless friendships form naturally through social clubs, English-speaking groups, and shared experiences.

Healthcare access is excellent with regional hospitals within 30 minutes and private clinics offering English-speaking doctors throughout the area. Evenings might include dinner at family-run restaurants serving traditional Spanish paella or fresh seafood, often within walking distance of your home. The proximity to Blue Flag beaches means afternoon coastal walks are routine, while several championship golf courses nearby cater to enthusiasts. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets plus vibrant weekly markets offering superior Spanish produce. Whether you prefer active pursuits or leisurely Mediterranean living, Rojales delivers the perfect balance.
investmentSection: This property represents intelligent investment alongside lifestyle choice. Currently priced at €3,446/m²—significantly above the Rojales average of €2,200/m² due to premium specification—the market fundamentals support your purchase. Costa Blanca property values have increased 8% year-on-year, outpacing inflation and delivering genuine appreciation. The rental market remains robust with typical weekly rates of €800 for similar 2-bedroom properties, generating approximately €41,600 annually if rented seasonally. Many retirees use this income to offset property costs and enjoy tax benefits. Whether you plan permanent residency or seasonal occupation with rental periods, the investment performs well. Compared to Spanish island markets where equivalent properties cost 40% more, this represents exceptional value in a growing market.
conclusion:
This exceptional 2-bedroom bungalow represents far more than property purchase—it's your gateway to the peaceful, authentic retirement you've earned. At €261,900 with premium specification and 40% savings versus Spanish island equivalents, combined with 8% annual market appreciation and €800 weekly rental potential, the investment fundamentals are compelling. But the real value lies in daily life: Mediterranean sunshine every morning, healthcare professionals who speak your language, a welcoming expat community, and a cost of living that transforms your retirement income into genuine abundance.

Rojales embodies the authentic Spain you imagined, without resort-area prices or tourist crowds. This is real living—market shopping, village restaurants, golf courses, beaches—available to you daily. Your retirement deserves location and lifestyle matching your vision. This home delivers both.

The regional hospital complex lies within 30 minutes, offering full emergency services and specialist departments. Prescription medications are affordable and widely available. The Spanish healthcare system is excellent, consistently ranking among Europe's finest, and many residents continue private health insurance providing additional peace of mind.

faqs.question: Combien coûte ce bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: €261,900. This 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow offers premium specification at significantly below Spanish island market rates. The price represents excellent value given current market trends and property quality.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property market. Values increased 8% year-on-year, the climate is Mediterranean perfection, and established infrastructure supports both residents and investors. Rojales specifically offers authentic Spanish living without resort-area premium pricing.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. You don't require Spanish residency, though many buyers do obtain it for tax and healthcare benefits. Legal processes are straightforward with proper professional guidance.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is excellent for retirees. The climate supports health, healthcare is comprehensive with English-speaking doctors, the cost of living is affordable, and established expat communities provide social structure. Rojales specifically combines authentic Spanish culture with modern amenities perfect for retirement.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond purchase price, expect transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5%), legal fees (1%), and registration costs (0.5-1%). Total acquisition costs typically amount to 8-12% of purchase price. Les taxes foncières annuelles are minimal, usually under 0.5% of property value.

faqs.question: Combien coûtent les taxes foncières en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) in Rojales averages 0.4-0.5% of property value—approximately €1,048-€1,310 yearly for this property. This is exceptionally affordable compared to UK council taxes. No wealth tax applies to Spanish property owners.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can obtain Spanish mortgages. Spanish banks typically offer 60-80% loan-to-value for non-residents, with competitive rates similar to UK mortgages. Many retirees prefer purchasing outright to avoid complications, though financing is definitely available.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is 25-35% below UK prices for groceries, utilities, and dining. Healthcare is affordable, property taxes minimal, and entertainment inexpensive. A comfortable retirement lifestyle costs significantly less than equivalent UK living, allowing retirement income to stretch substantially further.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is 35 minutes from this property, offering direct flights to London, Manchester, and other UK cities in 2-2.5 hours. Budget airlines provide frequent connections, making UK visits straightforward and affordable—most retirees visit 2-3 times yearly.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 300 days annual sunshine, average temperatures 25°C summer and 12°C winter. Rainfall is minimal and concentrated in autumn. The climate is ideal for those escaping harsh northern winters while remaining warm enough for year-round outdoor activities.
